image.altText: boxing glove

props.synopsis: Some parents say they saw an almost immediate improvement in their children's self-confidence after starting martial arts. But it's not about using violence to address violence.

title.children: Frustrated with bullying, these parents enrolled their kids in self-defence

image.altText: David speaks into a microphone as supporters' signs wave behind him and a guy holds a guitar.

props.synopsis: Former military lawyer David McBride challenges his jail sentence for distributing classified material to journalists over a ruling he says deprived him of a defence.

title.children: Jailed whistleblower David McBride appeals conviction

image.altText: Wild horses grazing in an alpine area.

props.synopsis: NSW Environment Minister Penny Sharpe has indicated that the wild horse management program at Kosciuszko National Park is ahead of schedule and that between 3,000 and 4,000 animals remain.

title.children: Brumby numbers 'way down' in Kosciuszko, aerial shooting paused

image.altText: A 10-year-old boy in a Ferrari cap stands on a karting track with his arms crossed.

props.synopsis: While other Year 5 students are playing football or reading a book, Canberran Lazarus Añonuevo is turning heads on go-karting circuits around Australia and overseas in his pursuit to become a Formula One driver.

title.children: Canberra go-karting prodigy making Formula One dream a reality

image.altText: A man smiles for the camera

props.synopsis: Nicole Williams pleaded guilty to attempted aggravated burglary and accessory after the fact to murder for her involvement in the death of Glenn Walewicz, and was today sentenced to seven years in jail.

title.children: It was a killing that baffled police. Now its mastermind has been jailed

image.altText: A fishing boat listing on the ocean after crashing into rocks.

props.synopsis: Beaches at a popular New South Wales Far South Coast tourist town have become littered with debris after a commercial fishing vessel ran aground this week.

title.children: Idyllic beaches littered with debris and diesel from NSW shipwreck

image.altText: Glenn Maxwell plays a shot against England at the Champions Trophy.

props.synopsis: Cricket Australia "postponed" its 2021 Test match with Afghanistan over concerns about the Taliban's human rights abuses against women, and did not play in the subsequent 2023 or 2024 series, but says it will fulfil its ICC Champions Trophy tournament obligations.

title.children: Australian cricket team play Afghanistan despite boycotting other matches

image.altText: Three women look at the camera.

props.synopsis: Not sure what to pack for your baby during a disaster? The Australian Breastfeeding Association has prepared a guide.

title.children: Mum rues leaving baby essentials behind in bushfire evacuation 'mad rush'

image.altText: An Indigenous AFL player lifts his shirt and points to the colour of his skin in response to racial vilification by the crowd.

props.synopsis: Lawyers say former Indigenous footballer Nicky Winmar could spearhead a class action racism lawsuit against the AFL.

title.children: Former player Nicky Winmar joins class action against AFL, lawyers say

image.altText: A bearded man in a turban.

props.synopsis: Rajwinder Singh's blue Alfa Romeo was one of about 70 identified as potentially being linked to the movements of murder victim Toyah Cordingley's phone, a court has heard.

title.children: Jury shown CCTV of alleged murderer's car on day Toyah Cordingley died

image.altText: People filling up sandbags.

props.synopsis: It's the first time many people in south-east Queensland will experience the direct effects of a tropical cyclone, scheduled to make landfall later this week. Here's how you can make sure you're prepared.

title.children: Here's what you can do to prepare for Tropical Cyclone Alfred

image.altText: An older couple sit side by side in a waiting room, in front of a large sign that says "Medicare Urgent Care Clinic".

props.synopsis: The health minister says a historical quirk is behind why two-thirds of existing and promised Medicare urgent care clinics are in Labor-held seats, and they are committed based on need.

title.children: Is Labor pork-barrelling with its urgent care clinics?

image.altText: A smiling, middle-aged blonde woman in dark evening wear.

props.synopsis: A former NSW juvenile corrections officer jailed for sexually abusing five boys is appealing her conviction and prison sentence on the grounds she was the victim of a miscarriage of justice.

title.children: Corrections officer appeals her conviction for sexually abusing teen inmates

image.altText: Mikey Madison wins the Oscar for Best Actress for Anora

props.synopsis: Take a look back at the key moments from the 97th Annual Academy Awards.

title.children: The biggest moments from the 2025 Oscars ceremony

image.altText: A woman in a red sweater looks at the camera as she leaves a court building followed by a man and another woman

props.synopsis: Lawyers for a Tasmanian couple convicted of the 2009 shooting murder of their former son-in-law have argued there is a "real possibility" someone else committed the crime — a theory the prosecution says is "fanciful".

title.children: Couple appeal guilty verdict by saying someone else murdered estranged son-in-law

image.altText: A Soyuz‑2.1b rocket launches.

props.synopsis: Tasmanians have been told debris from a Russian rocket could fall in waters near the island, with the possibility of a "sonic boom" accompanying its re-entry to the Earth's atmosphere over the next few days.

title.children: Russian rocket debris and sonic boom possible off Tasmanian coast

image.altText: A woman in a yellow jacket and sunglasses

props.synopsis: Northern Territory Aboriginal legal service NAAJA has reached a settlement with its former chief executive Priscilla Atkins, ending a bitter legal dispute over her wrongful dismissal dating back to early 2023.

title.children: Aboriginal legal service and former CEO settle long-running legal dispute

image.altText: Cronulla Sharks players in a huddle inside Allegiant Stadium

props.synopsis: The NRL reported an attendance of over 45,000 fans for this year's Vegas trip, but Peter V'Landys is worried by the empty seats during what should've been the headliner between the Sharks and Panthers.

title.children: Thousands of empty seats force NRL to consider major Las Vegas re-think

image.altText: Vincent Fantauzzo

props.synopsis: How the famous portrait of the Hollywood actor forged an enduring bond between his grieving father and the artist, Vincent Fantauzzo.

title.children: How Kim Ledger became an unlikely father figure to the man who painted his son, Heath's, portrait

image.altText: Close up headshot of Starmer and Zelenskyy talking.

props.synopsis: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer says the UK, France and Ukraine will devise a peace plan to end the conflict, as European nations vow to join a "coalition of the willing" to help Ukraine.

title.children: UK's prime minister warns Europe at 'crossroads in history' on Ukraine war

image.altText: Man in trucker hat holds baby while walking

props.synopsis: Lawyers for Matt Wright have issued a subpoena to NT Police for five documents related to the covert surveillance and investigation into the Netflix star, four months out from his Supreme Court trial.

title.children: Matt Wright's lawyers subpoena NT Police documents ahead of trial

image.altText: Cosco Valencia at Port Phillip

props.synopsis: Cash-only stores, unmarked white vans, and a shipping container with falsified documents. Where does Australia's illegal cigarette trade begin?

title.children: More than a million illicit cigarettes are on this ship headed for Australia

image.altText: Copy of Copy of Patrick Mellor sentenced for Assault at the Magistrates Court

props.synopsis: A protester was suspended 20 metres in the air, attached to logging machinery, when forestry worker Patrick John Mellor cut one of the ropes. She could be heard screaming, while Mellor walked away sipping his drink.

title.children: Logger sentenced after cutting rope on forest protester's platform

image.altText: A man in a headdress and reflective sunglasses raises a fist as he and other dance in a country area.

props.synopsis: A Victorian music festival has been given the green light to go ahead this weekend despite council officers recommending it be shut down.

title.children: Victorian music festival gets green light despite health, safety fears

image.altText: An older man with white short hair, thick-framed glasses and a suit stands next to a piece of glass outside, reflecting his face

props.synopsis: Stuart MacGill was first charged in 2023 for his alleged role in the supply of a commercial quantity of the prohibited substance. However, his lawyers said everything would depend on evidence from his drug dealer.

title.children: Former Australian cricketer faces trial over alleged role in cocaine deal

image.altText: the outside of a casino building

props.synopsis: Shares in Star Entertainment have been suspended from trading on the stock exchange after it failed to lodge its financial results, leaving the future of the company and its thousands of workers uncertain as efforts to secure a financial lifeline go down to the wire.

title.children: Star Entertainment on brink of collapse as shares suspended

image.altText: A fillet of pink salmon seen on rocks.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's Environment Protection Authority does not know how many farmed salmon have died in recent weeks or what the impact of antibiotic use is.

title.children: 'Self-reporting' salmon industry leaves EPA in dark over mortality figures

image.altText: A shot of a stadium during a rugby league match

props.synopsis: As the dust settles on the NRL's second trip to the USA, the sport's American dreams are starting to change shape.

title.children: Vegas experiment a winner for league fans but is it converting anyone?

image.altText: Cynthia Erivo wearing a dark green dress with a big pointy collar and long finger nails

props.synopsis: While the Oscars are all about movies, to many people the real show is the pre-event fashion.

title.children: Cynthia Erivo and Ariana Grande mute signature Wicked hues on red carpet

image.altText: Members of the Kyneton Women's Eagles Football Club at a training session.

props.synopsis: The newly formed Kyneton Women's Football Club have nowhere to play for 2025 after being rejected from three local leagues in what their president has called “systemic neglect”.

title.children: Kyneton women's team search for home after 'systemic neglect'

image.altText: Chief Petty Officer Medic Peter Gough leads solo rowboat adventurer Aurimas Mockus to the ship's hospital onboard HMAS Choules.

props.synopsis: Aurimas Mockus was attempting to row from San Diego to Brisbane when he was caught in the path of the category one system off the Queensland coast.

title.children: Lithuanian rower rescued after being caught in Tropical Cyclone Alfred

image.altText: A photo of Emmanuel College in Warrnambool, with several students sitting on the lawn

props.synopsis: A former teacher takes a Victorian Catholic school to the Fair Work Commission, alleging she was fired after raising concerns about bullying within staff.

title.children: Private school teacher allegedly sacked after flagging staff bullying

image.altText: An aerial photo of a seaside caravan park.

props.synopsis: Residents say they have been living in limbo for over nine months during negotiations for the potential sale of the caravan park and chalets they call home.

title.children: Caravan park residents fear 'vacant possession' sale, lease termination

image.altText: A man in cricket whites, with white hair, bowls a ball on a cricket field.

props.synopsis: Bradley O'Dell enters the record books by taking all 10 wickets in a single innings — including a hat-trick — during a local cricket competition in Newcastle.

title.children: 'Crazy' as 65-year-old nabs 10 wickets in single innings
